description: Key parts of the legislation governing artificial intelligence came into force on Saturday. Washington and American tech giants have not given up on their coordinated offensive against this law and, more broadly, against European digital regulation.

Up to a million young Catholics expected in Rome for Pope Leo vigil
description: The 'Jubilee of Youth' – when the Vatican invites Catholics aged 18 to 35 to the seat of the global Church's power – has brought thousands of young pilgrims from around the world to Rome this week. The night-time vigil on Saturday is the culmination of this week-long pilgrimage.

headline: Luca de Meo's massive welcome package at Kering
description: The former Renault chief could receive a signing bonus of €20 million upon joining the luxury group, along with an annual fixed salary of €2.2 million.

headline: In Monaco, chef Marcel Ravin's Creole garden
description: 'Chefs' Gardens' (3/5). Since 2022, the Martinique-born chef, who has been awarded two Michelin stars, has planted Caribbean varieties within the Monegasque palace that houses his fine dining restaurant.

headline: How France's 1975 amicable divorce law transformed gender relations
description: On July 11, 1975, France authorized divorce by mutual consent, marking a turning point for couples.

description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (5/6). Writer, actress and theater director, the now 60-something Emine Sevgi Özdamar arrived in Germany from Turkey as a young woman to work in a factory. Very quickly, the aspiring actress discovered a new way of making theater.

headline: Locals in Mexico City rise up against gentrification
description: Soaring rents in the Mexican capital have driven hundreds of residents into the streets to protest against property speculation, a shortage of housing and the arrival of 'digital nomads' in certain neighborhoods.

headline: The friends who cement their platonic relationships through marriage
description: Difficult to quantify because they are often unofficial, unions between friends have been growing. They offer a way to honor friendship at a time when people are challenging the traditional, heteronormative couple and its conventions.
